meanings.definition: A visible impression or trace on a surface.
meanings.sent1: She found a small mark on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The teacher put a check mark next to the correct answer.
meanings.sent3: The detective followed the marks left by the suspect.
meanings.sent4: His kindness left a mark on her heart.
meanings.sent5: The mark on the tree showed where the squirrel had climbed.

meanings.definition: A symbol or character used in writing or printing.
meanings.sent1: The book had a strange mark on the cover.
meanings.sent2: In English, the question mark is used to end a sentence.
meanings.sent3: The mark on the map indicated a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a punctuation mark in his day.
meanings.sent5: The mark on the coin represented the country of origin.

meanings.definition: A sign or indication of something.
meanings.sent1: Dark clouds were a mark of the coming storm.
meanings.sent2: His tired eyes were a clear mark of sleepless nights.
meanings.sent3: The sudden silence was a mark of their surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a mark of her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The mark of a good leader is inspiring others to do their best.

meanings.definition: A grade or score given for academic work.
meanings.sent1: She was proud of the high mark she received on the test.
meanings.sent2: The red mark on the paper indicated a mistake.
meanings.sent3: Getting a low mark on the project was a wake-up call for him.
meanings.sent4: His determination earned him a top mark in the class.
meanings.sent5: The mark on his report card reflected his hard work.

meanings.definition: To make a visible impression on a surface.
meanings.sent1: He tried to mark his name on the tree with a knife.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a brush to mark the canvas with colors.
meanings.sent3: She wanted to mark her territory by planting flowers.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor marked the stone with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The dog tried to mark its territory by urinating on the fence.
